intro: Thlaspi oligospermum, commonly known as the rock白菜 or mountain cabbage, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial plant characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually fleshy and covered in a waxy layer, which helps reduce water loss. Thlaspi oligospermum is also noted for its ability to accumulate heavy metals, making it a potential indicator species for soil contamination.
